intro: Ardisia mombachoana, commonly known as the Mombacho ardisia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are attractive to birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a glossy surface and a dark green color. Ardisia mombachoana thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
